title: App Icon Showing new messages
creator: Decapod
content:
I am currently using Thunderbird 140.6.0esr (64-bit). Operating system is Windows10, my computer doesn't meet Windows11 requirements.

I use Thunderbird to receive messages from both my Orange.fr and Gmail.com accounts. I use the Message Filters tool on both accounts to sort the incoming messages into different folders to make it easier to follow threads. I have Thunderbird running in the background all the time that my computer is active.

The Thunderbird Icon on the taskbar is set to show new messages. It used to show the total of all incoming messages, but now (I think just since the latest update) it only shows those new messages that have remained in the main inbox of either account, any messages that have been sorted into sub-folders are not included in the number shown on the icon. This means that when I have been away from the computer leaving Thunderbird running I now have to enter Thunderbird to see if any new messages have been sorted rather than just glancing at the taskbar.

What setting have I missed or is this a "bug".

More an annoyance than big issue. Thanks in advance for any guidance you can provide.

John Shelley

john.shelley1@orange.fr
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Windows 10 home, 22H2, 19045.6466;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/appearance-panel-layout-message-list-card-view-tab"]

title: New printer will not print emails
creator: kim85
content: I have a new Brother printer MFC-L3780CDW. I can print from Foxfire internet, I can print from Microsoft Word. I can go to my Comcast online account and print emails, but I cannot print an email from Thunderbird from my desk top. I right click the email to bring up the menu. I select print and nothing happens. It dont bring up a print preview window to select printer. It does nothing. My old printer was also a Brother MFC, just an older model. everything worked fine. I called brother and they say since everything else prints it must be a problem in the Thunderbird Application

title: Recipient autocomplete: Show name of address book for suggested contacts
creator: mzhx
content:
Hello, I just installed a clean version of Thunderbird (version 146.0.1) and set up my email accounts and CardDAV address books.

I do have multiple address books and I tried to find a setting to show the name of the address book for each contact shown in the suggestion list for recipients when composing a new email. However, I could only find a general setting to get suggestions for recipients from local address books, nothing more specific.

On a different device I still have Thunderbird 140.6.0esr installed. There, the suggestion list does indeed show the name of the address book next to the suggested contact: "name of contact <email@address> - name of addressbook"

I tried to find a corresponding setting for this in version 140.6.0esr, but without success.

So I'm wondering:

  1. Did the style/layout of the suggestion list change in recent versions?
  2. Does a setting exist to show the name of the address book in the suggestion list?

Additional info: The only extension that is installed and enabled on both devices is ImportExportTools NG.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0

title: Copia perfil de mi Thunderbird
creator: LFRP
content:
Hola. Para mi tranquilidad, quiero guardar una copia de mi perfil completo de Thunderbird. 1. Utilizando la herramienta de Exportación, he conseguido un archivo zip (Thunderbird_profile_backup) el cual al descomprimirlo, compruebo que contiene una única carpeta (g3snubiu.default-esr, con 5 carpetas y 64 archivos).

2. Sin embargo, la Carpeta Profiles, de mi Thunderbird, contiene dos subcarpetas. Una es la 76rg61v7.default (conteniendo solo un PDF, (times.json) y la otra es g3snubiu.default-esr (con 14 carpetas y 65 archivos). Mi duda es cuál de las dos opciones contiene el perfil completo que quiero guardar. En principio, pienso que la carpeta Profiles, porque tiene mayor contenido, pero ... Adjunto imágenes de ello.

Por otro lado, he intentado copiar directamente la carpeta Profiles. Se inicia la copia y de pronto se interrumpe apareciendo un aviso de que el archivo 1764189287131.706c0a04-aa31-4173-b29f-b2d220526bf5.main.jsonlz4, ubicado en la ruta C:\Users\Usuario\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\g3snubiu.default-esr\datareporting\archived\2025-11, NO SE PUEDE MOVER debido a un error inesperado. Error 0x80070570 "El archivo o directorio es ilegible o está dañado". Adjunto imagen del aviso. El resto se copia bien, excepto este archivo en concreto. La otra duda que tengo a este respecto es si es un archivo muy importante o no lo es; y si lo es, cómo puedo salvar la prohibición de copiarlo, si ello es posible.

¿Pueden ayudarme para conseguir mi objetivo de poder guardar una copia de seguridad de mi Thunderbird para el caso de tener que insertarla en otro pc o de tener algún problema de funcionamiento de Windows y deba de formatear.

Muchas gracias y un saludo.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 10 con la últimas actualizaciones.
